reviewText:
Little Buggy, Snap points dont seem to load sometimes forcing you to think why the bridge seems to fall apart when you you start the simulation even though its correct and following the help guide they provide.

quitting the game and loading back in seems to do the trick.

Good time killer but dont expect much game time, you get bored to easily!

£6.29 on steam sale seems too much for a very repetitive small Game, wait for it to drop a little and grab something similar on your phone, does the same job :)

reviewText: It's a fun little time killer" game
date:
has some issues but still fun.

Issues:
-Snap points don't always seems to work

Pro's:
+ Fun little puzzle game for those moments in between
+ Offers some interesting challenges
+ Make your own levels

Cons:
- Tutorial not skippable
- All levels have to be done in order
- Not a lot of content (50 levels but all I've seen so far very short)
- Not cheap at EUR 9.99 (or the current 8
recommended:
99 I spent on it)

Conclusion:
I've enjoyed the game so far and will finish all the levels so I can recommend the game
hoursPlayed: however I do hope some extra level packs will be added either in the game or as cheap DLC (or comunity level packs will become available - on that subject: why is there no steam workshop integration for that!?)"

reviewText:
This game is a typical bridge simulator, but its a bit sloppy.

Two main issues:
1. Draw bridges are goofy and have a lot of weird oddities. They snap open or closed to surrounding roadways, which is just dumb.
2. You have to progress through the bridges one at a time. Don't like a scenario? Too bad, you can try another bridge until you beat the one you're on.

Graphics are ok, controls are ok, but overall, just feels sloppy.
Im sorry but i played better bridge games and the effects are so bad, plus this is like a puzzle game not a simulation.
Very buggy.  I cant progress past one of the tutorial stages due to a bug.  Tried solutions mentioned by others, still wont work.
voteText: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: As a fan of bridge building games, I was well entertained by the 5-6 hours of gameplay in Bridge!2. The graphics are fine, the gameplay has a very gentle difficulty curve, and the missions are varied enough to keep your interest. The interface could use a little bit of polish, especially when it comes to making the differences clear between hard connections and movable joints, but since it's only 10 bucks, there is nothing really I could complain about. If you like bridge building games, Bridge!2 is well worth a look.

reviewText:
Bridge 2 is the successor of Bridge Project, to keep it short and sweet; i own the first part and ill show you the pros and cons...

Tutorial:

B2:  You cant skip it, you have to do it

Difficulty:

Can´t choose it you have to begin with the Easy Campain - Level 1 - ?, one after another, 1.2.3.4.----; remind me of a school day....*headache*

Graphics: Looks real nice, fluid and good choiced colors.

Music: Nice ambient music

Sfx: Normal, nothing bad


The only 2 things i really hate are:

1. The Tutorial (not skipable ^^)
2. the very strict level tree

Can i recommend the game...?...Yes, but its no game for badass hardcore shooter cracks.
